Baylor — 11/21/2010, from SoonerScoop.com, 375379=2009 (Sophomore): All-Big 12 first team punt returner by ESPN.com, Fort Worth Star Telegram, Kansas City Star, Phil Steele and Waco Tribune Herald ... All- Big 12 second team by AP, coaches and Dallas Morning News ... set an OU season record with 89 receptions and tied TD mark at 15 ... yardage total of 1,120 ranks No. 3 at OU ... his 1,776 all purpose yards rank No. 9 at OU and 492 punt return yards rank No. 5 ... set OU record with 6.61 catches/game ... ranked No. 4 nationally in punt return yards (15.87), No. 11 in receiving yards (93.33) and No. 12 in receptions per game (7.42) ... left Miami game with a shoulder injury on second offensive play and missed the Baylor game ... MVP and Offensive MVP of Sun Bowl with 13 receptions (OU and Sun Bowl Record) for a career-high 156 yards and three TDs (OU bowl and Sun Bowl record) ... five multi-score games ... 11 catches each vs. Tulsa and Kansas ... three TD receptions vs. Idaho State, Tulsa and Stanford ... first career rushing TD came vs. Texas A&M (25 yards) ... career-high 209 punt return yards vs. Oklahoma State, including a career-long 87-yard return for a TD ... third player in school history to record 100-plus yards in one game in two different categories (209 punt returns and 103 receiving) vs. OSU ... had 316 all-purpose yards vs. OSU, the third-best total in school history ... first receiver in the 72 years in which stats have been tracked at OU to lead team in scoring., 439443=Secret's out: OU's Broyles something special — 9/7/2008, from Rivals.com College Football, 425376=Breaking down the Oklahoma offense — 11/3/2009, from HuskersIllustrated.com, 431820=Norvell sees WR plan come together — 4/2/2009, from SoonerScoop.com, 414486=Week 3 preview in the Mountain West — 9/16/2010, from Rivals.com College Football, 401231=Staying in school nothing new for Broyles, OU — 2/16/2011, from Rivals.com College Football, 385866=Sooners turn top ten showdown into blowout win — 10/29/2011, from SoonerScoop.com, 384200=Week 11 preview in the Big 12 — 11/10/2011, from Rivals.com College Football, 430724=Plenty of positives heading into 2009 — 5/4/2009, from SoonerScoop.com, 374449=2010 (Junior): Consensus All-American ... Biletnikoff Award finalist ... consensus All-Big 12 ... No. 2 in the NCAA receptions, No. 4 in receiving yards ... owns 10 school records, nine that were set in 2010 -- receptions in a game (15 vs. Iowa State), season receptions, career receptions, receiving yards in a game (208 vs. Colorado), season receiving yards, career receiving yards, season TD receptions, career touchdown receptions, season 100-yard games and career 100-yard games ... a reception in 38 consecutive games ... three receiving TDs vs. Colorado and Texas Tech (five career three-TD games) ... over 100-yard mark in 12 of last 16 games and scored TD in 12 of last 17 ... had 10+ receptions in five games ... career-long 81-yard TD reception vs. Colorado ... has 16 plays of 40+ yards in his career ... textBeforeTable: Scouting Audibles Bio Videos Statistics Updates With just one Saturday remaining between the Sooners season opening kickoff against Louisiana Tech and now, the Fearless 20 enters it's top 10 picks with one young Sooner ready for stardom and Oklahoma to hit a mark that Adrian Peterson's Sooners didn't do.[details] The Latest: Fearless 20: Sooners to Outdo Adrian Peterson? — 8/20/2014   Dominique Alexander Jonathan Alvarez Rodney Anderson Mark Andrews Dakota Austin Austin Bennett Curtis Bolton Devante Bond Grant Bothun Daniel Brooks Orlando Brown Hatari Byrd Gabriel Campbell Christian Daimler Alex Dalton Jamal Danley Ty Darlington Ricky DeBerry Matt Dimon Jordan Evans Tay Evans Bobby Evans Derek Farniok Dimitri Flowers Keith Ford Kenyon Frison Neville Gallimore Courtney Garnett Sam Grant Marcus Green Dahu Green Kahlil Haughton Dominique Hearne Nick Hodgson Wesley Horky John Humphrey Isaac
